input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to csv file containing information about the samples. See README for more information.

outdir.description: Path to the output directory where the results will be saved.

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

max_job_request_options.title: Max job request options
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory '8.GB'`

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

tracedir.description: Directory to keep pipeline Nextflow logs and reports.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

show_hidden_params.help_text: By default, parameters set as _hidden_ in the schema are not shown on the command line when a user runs with `--help`. Specifying this option will tell the pipeline to show all parameters.

pipeline_run_parameters.title: Pipeline run parameters
pipeline_run_parameters.description: General parameters for how the pipeline will be run

run_preprocessing_only.description: Run only the preprocessing part of the pipeline.
run_preprocessing_only.help_text: Stop the pipeline after running preprocessing sub-workflow, consisting of input_check, library size calculation, and preparation of input files channel.

run_bam_subsetting.description: If inputting subset bam files, you can skip the subset BAM step by setting this to false

run_rna_analysis.description: Controls whether RNA subworkflow will be run

run_alt_splicing_analysis.description: Controls whether the alt splicing subworkflow will be run

run_hlahd.description: If inputting HLA alleles you can skip running HLA-HD by setting this parameter to false. You need to have an additional column in the input file and call it `hla_alleles_path`.

hlahd_local_install.description: If true the locally downloaded HLA-HD in the bin folder will be used. If false the hlahd.sif container will be used. See README for more details.

include_unmapped_reads_in_library_size.description: If true, unmapped reads are included in library size (e.g. samtools view -c -f 1 -F 2304). If false, unmapped reads are not included in library size (e.g. samtools view -c -f 1 -F 2308).

singularityDir.description: Path to directory to store singularity images downloaded by this pipeline

unmapped_reads.description: If true unmapped reads in the input BAM file are included in the subsetted BAM file

mhc_coords.description: Path to the file containing a set of genomic coordinates (chr:star-stop). Any read in the input BAM file that lies within these coordinates is included in the subsetted BAM.

fish_reads.description: If true reads in the input BAM files that contain a kmer from the kmer file (specified with the --kmer_file parameter) are included in the subsetted BAM.

fish_reads_only.description: If true only reads that contain a kmer from the kmer file are included in the subsetted BAM.

kmer_file.description: The file path to kmer file

contig_reads.description: If true reads that map to either: (1) any contig in the input BAM files (if the --contigs_file parameter is `null`), or (2) specific contigs listed in the file specified with the --contigs_file parameter, are included in the subsetted BAM file.

contigs_file.description: This file should contain a list of contigs present in the input BAM. Reads that map to these contigs will be included in the subsetted BAM file.

save_flagstat.description: Save flagstat output for sample bam

save_subset_bams.description: Save subset bams containing potential HLA reads

save_hla_fqs.description: Save HLA FQs containing potential HLA reads

hlahd_ignored_read_length.description: An HLA-HD parameter. A read whose length is shorter than this parameter is ignored.

hlahd_trimming_ratio.description: An HLA-HD parameter. If a match sequence is not found in the dictionary, trim the read until some sequence is matched to or reaches this ratio.

save_hlahd_predictions.description: Save the HLAHD predicted alleles (only the first prediction is output)

save_references.description: Save patient specific HLA reference files

hla_alignment.title: HLA alignment
hla_alignment.description: Specific parameters for the generation of HLA bam files

max_mismatch.description: The maximum number of mismatches allowed in a sequencing read aligned to the patient specific HLA reference. If a read alignment has more than this number of mismatches, it will be removed from the filtered HLA BAM file.

save_filtered_read_counts.description: Save file containing the read counts before and after filtering based on the number of mismatches.

uniq_num_across_junc.description: STAR parameter specifying the minimum number of unique reads supporting a junction in the first STAR run for the junction to be called.

save_cohort_sj_tab.description: Save cohort level splice junction table

codon_table.description: Path to a file that contains a mapping between the codons and amino acids.

min_depth.description: SNPs with less than min_depth in the germline will not be used to calculate DNA AIB and copy number.

quality_control_parameters.title: Quality control parameters
quality_control_parameters.description: Cutoff values for passing/failing samples/genes in the output tables.

min_frac_mapping_uniquely.description: The minimum fraction of RNAseq reads that need to align uniquely for the sample/gene to pass.

max_frac_mapping_multi_gene.description: The maximum fraction of RNAseq reads that can to align to multiple HLA genes for the sample/gene to pass.

min_number_of_snps.description: The minimum number of filtered SNPs in a gene for the sample/gene to pass.

max_copy_number_range.description: The maximum range in the DNA copy number for the sample/gene to pass.

min_expected_depth.description: The minimum expected DNA depth required for the sample/gene to pass.
